articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin, Jack Kim
articles.description: The flight data and cockpit voice recorders on the Jeju Air jet that crashed on Dec. 29 stopped recording about four minutes before the airliner hit a concrete structure at South Korea's Muan airport, the transport ministry said on Saturday.
articles.title: Jeju Air 'black box' data missing from last 4 minutes before crash, South Korea ministry says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine launched drone attacks across several regions of Russia, striking two residential houses in the Tambov region and injuring at least three people, Russia said on Saturday.
articles.title: Russia says Ukrainian drones injure three in Tambov region

articles.author: Shoon Naing
articles.description: Dozens of people were killed in an air strike by Myanmar's military government in the western state of Rakhine this week, the United Nations said, as the Southeast Asia nation's civil war nears its fourth year.
articles.title: Myanmar military air strike kills dozens in Rakhine village, UN says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, whose nearly 12 years in office have been marked by a deep economic and social crisis, is set to be sworn in for a third term on Friday, staying in power despite a six-month-long dispute over a July election and international calls for him to stand aside.
articles.title: Venezuela's Maduro to be sworn in for third term as opposition leader vows to return

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: But the strong winds that fanned the flames were expected to pick up again today, worsening conditions.
articles.title: Los Angeles firefighters see progress in containing blazes

articles.author: Timothy Gardner, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The Biden administration on Friday imposed its broadest package of sanctions yet targeting Russia's oil and gas revenues in an attempt to give Kyiv and the incoming administration of Donald Trump leverage to reach a deal for peace in Ukraine.
articles.title: Biden hits Russian oil in toughest sanctions yet in bid to give Ukraine, Trump leverage

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Marianna Parraga
articles.description: The United States on Friday imposed new sanctions on eight Venezuelan officials and increased to $25 million the reward it is offering for the arrest of President Nicolas Maduro on the day of his inauguration to a third term following a disputed election last year.
articles.title: US and allies slap sanctions on Venezuela officials as Maduro inaugurated

articles.author: Timour Azhari, John Irish
articles.description: U.S., French and German envoys have warned Syria's new Islamist rulers that their appointment of foreign jihadists to senior military posts is a security concern and bad for their image as they try to forge ties with foreign states, two sources familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Western powers warn Syria over foreign jihadists in army, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands of protesters in the Slovak capital held banners and chanted slogans on Friday accusing Prime Minister Robert Fico of dragging the country towards Russia after he met President Vladimir Putin last month amid a gas dispute with Ukraine.
articles.title: Protesters say Fico dragging Slovakia to Russia in Ukraine gas dispute

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A suspected hitman accused of killing a Cambodian former opposition lawmaker in a brazen attack in Bangkok was handed over to Thai authorities on Saturday from Cambodia, where he had been arrested after crossing the border.
articles.title: Suspected killer of former Cambodia lawmaker sent to Thailand
